issuingActor.name: Document Consumer
issuingActor.description: The Document Consumer Actor queries a Document Registry Actor for documents meeting certain criteria, and retrieves selected documents from one or more Document Repository actors.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identifier Cross-reference Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a system in a Patient Identification Domain to find out the identification of a patient in a different Patient Identification Domain by using the services of a Patient Identity Cross-Reference Manager Actor.

issuingActor.name: Document Administrator
issuingActor.description: The Document Administrator actor supports metadata update by issuing the Update Document Set transaction [ITI-57] and Delete Document Set [ITI-61 ] transaction to the Document Registry actor.

issuingActor.name: Portable Media Creator
issuingActor.description: This actor assembles the content of the media and writes it to the physical medium.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Cross-reference Manager
issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identifier Cross-reference Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a system in a Patient Identification Domain to find out the identification of a patient in a different Patient Identification Domain by using the services of a Patient Identity Cross-Reference Manager Actor.

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Image Display
issuingActor.description: A part of a system that can access imaging evidence objects (images, Presentation States, Key Image Notes, Evidence Documents) through network query/retrieve or reading interchange media and allow the user to view these objects.

issuingActor.name: Imaging Document Consumer
issuingActor.description: Retrieves imaging data based on references in a retrieved imaging manifest.

issuingActor.name: Secure Application
issuingActor.description: The difference between the Secure Node and the Secure Application is the extent to which the underlying operating system and other environment are secured. A Secure Node includes all aspects of user authentication, file system protections, and operating environment security. The Secure Application is a product that does not include the operating environment. The Secure Application provides security features only for the application features. See section 9.7 for the relationships among a Secure Node, Secure Application, and other actors.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Cross-reference Manager
issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Imaging Document Source
issuingActor.description: Publishes imaging data and makes it available for retrieval.

issuingActor.name: Resource Server
issuingActor.description: A server that provides services that need authorization

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: On-Demand Document Source
issuingActor.description: The On-Demand Document Source is the producer and publisher of On-Demand Documents. This actor registers On-Demand Document Entries with the Document Registry and responds to Retrieve Document Set transactions with a document reflecting current information for the entry requested.

issuingActor.name: Document Recipient
issuingActor.description: A system that receives documents and metadata sent by another actor.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Cross-reference Manager
issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identifier Cross-reference Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a system in a Patient Identification Domain to find out the identification of a patient in a different Patient Identification Domain by using the services of a Patient Identity Cross-Reference Manager Actor.

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Notification Broker
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Notification Broker is the receiver of the Document Metadata Subscribe transaction containing a subscription request, or a subscription cancellation. It keeps track of all subscriptions in the Metadata Notification domain, including the time limits of subscriptions. Based on the metadata associated with document registrations, this actor sends notifications to interested subscribers.

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Document Source
issuingActor.description: The Document Source is the producer and publisher of documents and metadata.

issuingActor.name: Image Manager/Archive
issuingActor.description: A system that provides functions related to safe data storage and image data handling. It supplies image availability information to the Department System Scheduler. It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

issuingActor.name: Responding Imaging Gateway
issuingActor.description: The responding Imaging Gateway proxies Cross Gateway Retrieve Imaging Document Set requests from an Initiating Imaging Gateway to an Imaging Document Source with an Image Document Set Retrieve request.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Supplier
issuingActor.description: A repository of patient information that can be searched on demographic or visit-related fields.

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Notification Broker
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Notification Broker is the receiver of the Document Metadata Subscribe transaction containing a subscription request, or a subscription cancellation. It keeps track of all subscriptions in the Metadata Notification domain, including the time limits of subscriptions. Based on the metadata associated with document registrations, this actor sends notifications to interested subscribers.

issuingActor.name: Image Manager/Archive
issuingActor.description: A system that provides functions related to safe data storage and image data handling. It supplies image availability information to the Department System Scheduler. It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a user to associate information with a patient at the point of care.

issuingActor.name: Department System Scheduler/Order Filler
issuingActor.description: A department-based information system (for instance, Radiology or Laboratory) that provides functions related to the management of orders received from external systems or through the department system s user interface. Upon a defined workflow action, makes procedures available for charge posting. The action/event that actually causes charges to post is defined by the actor.

issuingActor.description: This actor allows a system in a Patient Identification Domain to find out the identification of a patient in a different Patient Identification Domain by using the services of a Patient Identity Cross-Reference Manager Actor.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Source
issuingActor.description: The Patient Identity Source is the producer and publisher of patient identity data.

issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Imaging Document Source
issuingActor.description: Publishes imaging data and makes it available for retrieval.

issuingActor.name: Audit Record Repository
issuingActor.description: A system unit that receives and collects audit records from multiple systems.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Source
issuingActor.description: The Patient Identity Source is the producer and publisher of patient identity data.

issuingActor.name: Department System Scheduler/Order Filler
issuingActor.description: A department-based information system (for instance, Radiology or Laboratory) that provides functions related to the management of orders received from external systems or through the department system s user interface. Upon a defined workflow action, makes procedures available for charge posting. The action/event that actually causes charges to post is defined by the actor.

issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Report Reader
issuingActor.description: A part of a system that can access reports through network query/retrieve or reading interchange media and allow the user to view reports presented as DICOM Structured Report Objects.

issuingActor.name: Image Manager/Archive
issuingActor.description: A system that provides functions related to safe data storage and image data handling. It supplies image availability information to the Department System Scheduler. It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

issuingActor.description: The Patient Identity Source is the producer and publisher of patient identity data.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Supplier
issuingActor.description: A repository of patient information that can be searched on demographic or visit-related fields.

issuingActor.name: Importer
issuingActor.description: A system that imports evidence documents such as images, presentation states, Key Image Notes or Evidence Documents from hardcopy or digital media.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a user to associate information with a patient at the point of care.

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Subscriber
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Subscriber actor initiates and terminates subscriptions on behalf of a Document Metadata Notification Recipient.

issuingActor.description: A system that provides functions related to safe data storage and image data handling. It supplies image availability information to the Department System Scheduler. It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

issuingActor.description: The difference between the Secure Node and the Secure Application is the extent to which the underlying operating system and other environment are secured. A Secure Node includes all aspects of user authentication, file system protections, and operating environment security. The Secure Application is a product that does not include the operating environment. The Secure Application provides security features only for the application features. See section 9.7 for the relationships among a Secure Node, Secure Application, and other actors.

issuingActor.name: On-Demand Document Source
issuingActor.description: The On-Demand Document Source is the producer and publisher of On-Demand Documents. This actor registers On-Demand Document Entries with the Document Registry and responds to Retrieve Document Set transactions with a document reflecting current information for the entry requested.

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a user to associate information with a patient at the point of care.

issuingActor.name: Secure Node
issuingActor.description: A system unit that validates the identity of any user and of any other node, and determines whether or not access to the system for this user and information exchange with the other node is allowed. Maintains the correct time.

issuingActor.name: Integrated Document Source/Repository
issuingActor.description: The Integrated Document Source/Repository is an XDS combination of Document Source and Document Repository that does not expose the interface between the Source and Repository. That is, this Source only publishes documents to its own Repository. It does register documents with a Document Registry

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Publisher
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Publisher actor sends a Document Metadata Publish transaction to the Document Metadata Notification Broker for any event for which a subscription exists.

issuingActor.name: Imaging Document Consumer
issuingActor.description: Retrieves imaging data based on references in a retrieved imaging manifest.

issuingActor.name: Report Repository
issuingActor.description: A system that provides long-term storage of reports and their retrieval as DICOM Structured Reporting Objects.

issuingActor.description: A part of a system that can access imaging evidence objects (images, Presentation States, Key Image Notes, Evidence Documents) through network query/retrieve or reading interchange media and allow the user to view these objects.

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Cross-reference Manager
issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Initiating Imaging Gateway
issuingActor.description: The Initiating Imaging Gateway Actor proxies Imaging Document Set Retrieve requests from an Image Document Consumer to a Responding Imaging Gateway with a Cross Gateway Retrieve Imaging Document Set transaction.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Consumer
issuingActor.description: This actor allows a user to associate information with a patient at the point of care.

It is always grouped with an Image Archive to provide long term storage of images, presentation states, Key Image Notes, and Evidence Documents.

issuingActor.description: A system unit that validates the identity of any user and of any other node, and determines whether or not access to the system for this user and information exchange with the other node is allowed. Maintains the correct time.

issuingActor.name: Patient Demographics Supplier
issuingActor.description: A repository of patient information that can be searched on demographic or visit-related fields.

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Notification Recipient
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Notification Recipient actor receives the notification about an event, when the subscription filters specified for this Document Metadata Notification Recipient are satisfied.

issuingActor.name: Document Consumer
issuingActor.description: The Document Consumer Actor queries a Document Registry Actor for documents meeting certain criteria, and retrieves selected documents from one or more Document Repository actors.

issuingActor.name: Document Consumer
issuingActor.description: The Document Consumer Actor queries a Document Registry Actor for documents meeting certain criteria, and retrieves selected documents from one or more Document Repository actors.

issuingActor.name: Authorization Client
issuingActor.description: A client that presents authorization tokens as part of transactions.

issuingActor.name: Document Metadata Notification Broker
issuingActor.description: The Document Metadata Notification Broker is the receiver of the Document Metadata Subscribe transaction containing a subscription request, or a subscription cancellation. It keeps track of all subscriptions in the Metadata Notification domain, including the time limits of subscriptions. Based on the metadata associated with document registrations, this actor sends notifications to interested subscribers.

issuingActor.name: Imaging Document Source
issuingActor.description: Publishes imaging data and makes it available for retrieval.

issuingActor.name: Document Registry
issuingActor.description: The Document Registry Actor maintains metadata about each registered document in a document entry. This includes a link to the Document in the Repository where it is stored. The Document Registry responds to queries from Document Consumer actors about documents meeting specific criteria. It also enforces some healthcare specific technical policies at the time of document registration.

issuingActor.name: Portable Media Importer
issuingActor.description: This actor reads the DICOM information (DICOM FSR) contained on the media. This system provides the user the ability to select a set of DICOM instances and reconcile key patient and study attributes (when necessary) to facilitate inclusion of the imported data in the local information system(s).

issuingActor.name: Patient Identity Cross-reference Manager
issuingActor.description: Serves a well-defined set of Patient Identification Domains. Based on information provided by in each Patient Identification Domain by a Patient Identification Source Actor, it manages the cross-referencing of patient identifiers across Patient Identification Domains.

issuingActor.name: Resource Server
issuingActor.description: A server that provides services that need authorization

issuingActor.name: External Report Repository Access
issuingActor.description: A system that performs retrieval of clinical reports containing information generated outside the Radiology department and presented as DICOM Structured Reporting Objects.
